result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Derek W Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $200 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Perform   80   hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  Hearing on 3/14/18 @ 8:30 for DPA in Count 1.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Frank Parise.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  DE has successfully completed the terms of the hold open agreement.  Supervision fees have been paid in full.  On the motion of the State, count 1 is dismissed.

ADDRESS INFO for Derek W Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Stipulated Hold Open Agreement - 24 months
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Derek W Jones, appeared with Attorney Frank j Parise.  Clerk: PT
Amended Information filed by the State and case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; judgment is withheld and parties enter into a Stipulated Hold Open Agreement for 2 years.
Counts 2 & 3 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.   As a condition he is ordered to complete 80 hours of community service.  Court imposes a fine of $200 plus costs on Counts 2 & 3 and costs to be paid during supervision. Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.  DPA Hearing on 3/14/18 at 8:30 AM.
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Frank Parise.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is resolved.  Plea and sentencing 3/10/16 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
